com.mr_apps.androidbase.adapter

Class AbstractHeaderFooterAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
      • com.mr_apps.androidbase.adapter.AbstractHeaderFooterAdapter

  • public abstract class AbstractHeaderFooterAdapter
extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
    Class that manages an abstract base adapter with header and footer, that every adapter can extend It provides method to add, remove and modify items from the list, and it also is generic so it is extensible by any type of adapter
    Author:
    Mattia Ruggiero, Denis Brandi

      • getItemViewType

        public int getItemViewType(int position)
        Description copied from class: android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
        Return the view type of the item at position for the purposes of view recycling.

        The default implementation of this method returns 0, making the assumption of a single view type for the adapter. Unlike ListView adapters, types need not be contiguous. Consider using id resources to uniquely identify item view types.

        Overrides:
        getItemViewType in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        position - position to query
        Returns:
        integer value identifying the type of the view needed to represent the item at position. Type codes need not be contiguous.

      • getItemCount

        public int getItemCount()
        Description copied from class: android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
        Returns the total number of items in the data set hold by the adapter.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        The total number of items in this adapter.

      • addItemInPosition

        public void addItemInPosition(RecyclerItem item,
                     int i)
        Adds an item at the given position. If the position where the item should be added contains a footer, the footer is automatically deleted.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to add
        i - the position of the new item

      • addItem

        public void addItem(RecyclerItem item)
        Adds an item to the end of the list. If the last item of the list is a footer, the footer is automatically deleted.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to add

      • addItems

        public void addItems(java.util.List<RecyclerItem> itemsToAdd,
            int positionToAdd)
        Adds a list of items at the given position. If the position where the items should be added contains a footer, the footer is automatically deleted.
        Parameters:
        itemsToAdd - the list of items to add
        positionToAdd - the position where the items have to be added

        Removes the footer of the list
